One day, a boy was looking in the garden. He saw a big wild cat. He wanted to pet it, so he slowly walked over. The cat seemed to be deaf, because it didn't move. The boy reached out and touched the cat, but it didn't move. Then he saw that it was dry. Suddenly, the cat jumped up and scratched the boy! It ran away, never to be seen again. The boy was sad,

Lila and Ben were playing in the park. They liked to run, slide and swing. They saw a big hill with colorful flowers. They wanted to climb the hill and smell the flowers.
"Come on, Ben, let's go up the hill!" Lila said.
"OK, Lila, but be careful. The hill is steep and there might be spikes on the flowers," Ben said.
They started to climb the hill. They held hands and helped each other. They saw many beautiful flowers. Some were red, some were yellow, some

Their mom said, "I love you, but you have to be careful and smart. Hide and seek is a fun game, but you have to follow the rules and respect the house. Now, go and play somewhere else. And be nice to each other."
They said, "We love you, too, mom. We will follow the rules and respect the house. And we will be nice to each other."

Once upon a time, there was a hungry butterfly. The butterfly did not know where to find food. It flew around looking for something to eat.
One day, the butterfly met a big, friendly bear. The bear knew where to find food. He said, "Come with me, little butterfly. I will show you where to find yummy flowers." The butterfly was very happy and said, "Thank you, big bear!"

two. The silver paint spilled on the floor. Tom and Lily were sad. They had no more silver paint. They had no more brush. They had no more fun.
Mom came and saw the mess. She was not happy. She asked them what happened. Tom and Lily told her the truth. They were sorry. They said they were sorry to each other too.
Mom hugged them and said, "It's good that you are sorry. But you should not fight over things. You should share and take turns. That's how you can be kind and happy. And that's how you can make beautiful paintings."

Once upon a time, there was a small boy named Jack. He had curly brown hair and a white shirt. He was standing in the middle of his garden, feeling happy and fit. 
One day, he wanted to have an adventure. So, he took a deep breath and started walking. He walked for what seemed like forever, until he reached a huge tree. 
Jack smiled and touched the trunk of the tree. "Hello oak tree," he said in a tiny voice.

"I can count more dust than you!"
The small, slow bug did not like this. He said, "No, I can count more dust!" So, they had a race to see who could count the most dust. The small bug tried very hard, but he was too slow. The big bug counted more dust.
The small, slow bug was sad. He knew he could not win. The big, fast bug laughed and said, "I am the best at counting dust!" The small bug felt bad and went back to his home under the bed. The end.

One day, a little girl named Lucy went to the park. She was restless and wanted to play. Lucy saw a boy named Tim with a whip. The whip was long and thin.
Lucy asked Tim, "Can I hold the whip?" Tim said, "Yes, you can." Lucy held the whip and swung it around. It made a big sound, like a snap.
They played with the whip all day. When they were tired, they sat on the grass. Lucy and Tim became friends and promised to play together
